course.subject: PSYCH
course.course_title: Introduction to Psychology: The Frontiers of Psychological Inquiry

notes.note: Register for either lecture 1 or 2 (whichever has room). Both lectures are the same.

topics.topic: FWS: Can Psych Make Us Happier

notes.note: May be used to satisfy the psychology major, breadth requirement and alternative prerequisite for biopsychology courses.
Recommended: introductory psychology or human development.
Prerequisites: Any one of the following: Psych 2230, NB2210, NB 2220 or one year of introductory biology plus a course in psychology.

course.subject: PSYCH
course.course_title: Human Perception: Application to Computer Graphics, Art, and Visual Display

notes.note: Recommended prerequisite: PSYCH 2050. 4-credit option is by permission of faculty.
The 4-credit version of the course also includes instruction in the use of the statistical software package R.
Enrollment limited to: Junior or Senior standing.
Prerequisites: sophomore standing and one course in psychology or sociology.
Prerequisites: At least one course in each of social and cognitive psychology. Priority given to senior psychology majors.

Prerequisites: two majors-level biology courses or; biopsychology or neurobiology (e.g.,Psych 2230 or BIONB 2210, BIONB 2220); and an introductory course in perception, cognition, or language (e.g., Psych 1102, Psych 2090, Psych 2140, or Psych 2150).
Prerequisites: Psych 2090 or HD 1150. Permission of instructor required.
Intended for Psych grad students only. All others by permission of instructor.

course.subject: PSYCH
course.course_title: Human Perception: Applications to Computer Graphics, Art, and Visual Display

notes.note: HD and PSYCH students only. Enrollment limited to 20.
Prerequisites: Psych 2090 or HD 1150. Permission of instructor required.

course.subject: PSYCH
course.course_title: Research in Social Psychology and Personality

course.course_title: Doctoral Thesis Research in Human Experimental Psychology

course.subject: PSYCH
course.course_title: Doctoral Thesis Research in Social Psychology and Personality
